name: Kepler-329
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-329 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-329 is a star with 0.41999999999999976 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.52 times its radius. It is located 1452.05 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-329 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-329 b

Kepler-329 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 7.42 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-329.

The mass of Kepler-329 b is 2.16 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-329 b is 1.4 that of Earth. At 2.16 Earth masses, Kepler-329 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-329 c

Kepler-329 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 18.68 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-329.

The mass of Kepler-329 c is 4.65 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-329 c is 1.93 that of Earth. At 4.65 Earth masses, Kepler-329 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-329, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
